result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel A Hincapie

defendant.name: Hincapie, Daniel A
defendant.address: 2915 West Saint Paul Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53208

records.addlTxt:
OFF RECORD - Attorney Kremer notified the Court that she is ill and unable to attend scheduled plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned in Branch 15. Parties notified.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Daniel A Hincapie in court with attorney Amanda R. Kremer.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requests a DPA hearing.
Court ordered matter adjourned.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed by Attorney Amanda Kremer.

Defendant Daniel A Hincapie in court.  
Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  Defendant does not qualify for a public defender.  Court conducted an Indigency Hearing and concluded defendant does not qualify.  Court ordered matter adjourned so defendant can try to retain counsel.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license and state required insurance.

Defendant Daniel A Hincapie in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kori Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/4/22 @ 1p
